net.allwebdesign.common.lib.db
Class DataHandler

java.lang.Object
  net.allwebdesign.common.lib.db.DataHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
GenericDataHandler
public abstract class DataHandler
extends Object

Datahandler is an abstract class that needs to be extended in the applications It acts as a wrapper class for accessing the core DAO.

Version:
1.0
Author:
George Moraitakis

runSproc

public DataResults runSproc(String sprocName,
                            Map<String,Object> args,
                            Object... staticArgs)
Runs a sproc with arguments constructed from the keys of the arguments passed (typically form params) and additional args. It assumes the form params are of the type rowXX_paramName.

Parameters:
sprocName - the sproc name
args - the map of arguments
staticArgs - static args (e.g. \@param = 1234)
Returns:
the results of the sproc

runSproc

public DataResults runSproc(String sprocName,
                            String flag,
                            String delim,
                            String row,
                            String argSymbol,
                            Map<String,Object> args,
                            Object... staticArgs)
Runs a sproc with arguments constructed from the keys of the arguments passed (typically form params) and additional args. It assumes the form params are of the type flagrowdelimparamName.

Parameters:
sprocName - the sproc name
flag - the flag of the rows to use (e.g. row)
delim - the delim of the rows to use (e.g. _)
row - a specific row number to use
argSymbol - the symbol to use for the sproc param (typically @)
args - the map of arguments
staticArgs - static args (e.g. \@param = 1234)
Returns:
the results of the sproc

runUpdateSproc

public void runUpdateSproc(String sprocName,
                           Map<String,Object> args,
                           Object... staticArgs)
Runs an updating sproc with arguments constructed from the keys of the arguments passed (typically form params) and additional args. It assumes the form params are of the type rowXX_paramName.

Parameters:
sprocName - the sproc name
args - the map of arguments
staticArgs - static args (e.g. \@param = 1234)

runUpdateSproc

public void runUpdateSproc(String sprocName,
                           String flag,
                           String delim,
                           String row,
                           String argSymbol,
                           Map<String,Object> args,
                           Object... staticArgs)
Runs an updating sproc with arguments constructed from the keys of the arguments passed (typically form params) and additional args. It assumes the form params are of the type flagrowdelimparamName.

Parameters:
sprocName - the sproc name
flag - the flag of the rows to use (e.g. row)
delim - the delim of the rows to use (e.g. _)
row - a specific row number to use
argSymbol - the symbol to use for the sproc param (typically @)
args - the map of arguments
staticArgs - static args (e.g. \@param = 1234)

runBatchUpdateSproc

public void runBatchUpdateSproc(String sprocName,
                                Map<String,Object> args,
                                Object... staticArgs)
Runs a batch of update sprocs based on how many data rows are included in the args. It assumes the form params are of the type rowXX_paramName.

Parameters:
sprocName - the sproc name
args - the map of arguments
staticArgs - static args (e.g. \@param = 1234)

runBatchUpdateSproc

public void runBatchUpdateSproc(String sprocName,
                                String flag,
                                String delim,
                                String argSymbol,
                                Map<String,Object> args,
                                Object... staticArgs)
Runs a batch of update sprocs based on how many data rows are included in the args. It assumes the form params are of the type flagrowdelimparamName.

Parameters:
sprocName - the sproc name
flag - the flag of the rows to use (e.g. row)
delim - the delim of the rows to use (e.g. _)
argSymbol - the symbol to use for the sproc param (typically @)
args - the map of arguments
staticArgs - static args (e.g. \@param = 1234)
